intro: Hieracium parcepilosum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium parcepilosum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
